title: Amazon AWS CEO Defends Five-Day In-Office Policy: "Quit if You Don't Like It"
news:
Amazon Web Services (AWS) CEO Matt Garman has defended the company's new mandatory five-day in-office work policy, starting in January 2025.  He stated at an all-hands meeting that the policy aims to foster a collaborative environment and drive innovation, claiming that remote work hinders these goals.

Garman acknowledged that some employees may not be comfortable with the new policy, and for them, he delivered a blunt message: "If there are people who just don’t work well in that environment and don’t want to, that’s okay, there are other companies around."

Garman cited the company's difficulty in innovating remotely as the primary reason for the change. He believes that the previous three-day in-office policy wasn't effective, stating that the "ability for us to really, really innovate on interesting products" is hindered by remote work. He also pointed out that Amazon's leadership principles are harder to apply in a remote work setting.

The new policy has faced criticism from some employees who argue that commuting is a waste of time and that the benefits of in-office work aren't backed by data. Reports suggest that some employees who didn't comply with the existing three-day policy were told they were "voluntarily resigning" and had their access to company systems revoked.

Despite the backlash, Garman remains optimistic about the change, stating that he's "quite excited about this." Amazon's return-to-office policy is stricter than many other tech companies, such as Google, Meta, and Microsoft, which have adopted more flexible policies requiring two to three days of in-office work.

title: Hindustan Zinc Q2 Earnings Preview: Strong Profit Growth Expected
news:
Hindustan Zinc Ltd. (HZL) is set to release its Q2 FY25 earnings on Friday, October 18th, with analysts expecting strong year-on-year (YoY) growth, driven by higher zinc and silver prices. While quarterly comparisons (QoQ) are projected to be muted, HZL is poised to benefit from expanded margins and higher sales volumes.

Brokerages anticipate significant jumps in net profit, Ebitda and revenue compared to last year. Nuvama Institutional Equities forecasts revenue of Rs 8,026 crore, up 18% YoY, while Motilal Oswal expects sales around Rs 7,800 crore, representing a 15% YoY increase. Kotak Institutional Equities projects revenue at Rs 7,985 crore, a 18% YoY rise.

All analysts highlight the positive impact of higher zinc and silver prices on HZL's performance. Nuvama expects lower zinc-lead prices to be offset by increased silver volume and reduced cost of production.  Kotak anticipates zinc, lead and silver sales to grow by 7%, 10.5%, and 1.7% YoY, respectively.

The dividend announcement and any updates regarding corporate structure changes are key aspects investors will be watching. 

While analysts generally foresee strong YoY earnings, the outlook for QoQ performance remains uncertain. Further insights on cost of production, volumes and realizations will provide crucial context for the company's future trajectory.

title: Mumbai Police Receives Threat Against Salman Khan
news:
Mumbai Police are investigating a threatening message demanding Rs 5 crore from actor Salman Khan. The message, allegedly sent by a member of the Lawrence Bishnoi gang, threatens to harm Khan if he does not pay. The message, sent via WhatsApp,  states that Khan will meet a fate worse than Baba Siddiqui, a former Maharashtra minister recently murdered by the Bishnoi gang.

The Bishnoi gang has a history of targeting Khan, including an April 2024 incident where two men on bikes opened fire outside his home. In June 2022, Khan received a handwritten note threatening him with the same fate as singer Sidhu Moose Wala, who was also murdered by the gang. 

Following the threats, Khan has taken security measures including purchasing a bulletproof car and requesting the extradition of Bishnoi gang members from Canada. The Mumbai Police are investigating the latest threat and working to ensure Khan's safety.

title: Indian Community in Malawi: A Living Link Between Nations
news:
President Droupadi Murmu, during her visit to Malawi, praised the Indian community for being a vital bridge between the two nations. Addressing the diaspora in Lilongwe, she lauded their contributions to Malawi's society and economy, urging them to participate in India's development journey. 

Murmu highlighted the Indian government's commitment to the welfare of its citizens abroad, emphasizing their safety, well-being, and prosperity as priorities. She also underscored India's role as a leading voice for the Global South, representing the interests of a majority of the world's population and sharing its expertise with developing nations.

Further strengthening the India-Malawi relationship, Murmu reiterated India's dedication to fostering partnerships with Africa, founded on principles of mutual trust, equality, and shared benefits. She emphasized the importance of harnessing local resources and building capacity based on Africa's needs.  

This year marks the 60th anniversary of diplomatic ties between India and Malawi, symbolizing a deep and longstanding relationship. Murmu highlighted the potential for enhanced bilateral cooperation in various sectors, including agriculture, mining, energy, and tourism.

title: Infosys Shares: Mixed Q2 Results Leave Investors Uncertain
news:
Infosys, a major IT services company, delivered mixed results in its second quarter, leaving investors questioning the future of the stock. While revenue growth was solid, with early signs of a rebound in discretionary spending, margins and deal wins fell short of expectations. 

The company raised its FY25 revenue guidance to 3.75-4.5% in constant currency terms, but maintained its EBIT margin guidance at 20-22%. This suggests cautious optimism about the future, but potential challenges in profitability. 

Analysts remain cautiously positive. While some, like Nuvama Institutional Equities, are maintaining their "Buy" rating, others, like Nirmal Bang, are suggesting a "Hold". The key point of contention is the company's lower-than-expected deal wins and margins, especially in the face of increasing competition. 

Despite challenges, Infosys is well-positioned to capitalize on growth opportunities, particularly in Financial Services. The company's expertise in cloud technology and generative AI provides a competitive edge in the evolving IT landscape.

**Overall, Infosys shares remain a complex investment. While the long-term outlook remains positive, the short-term uncertainty necessitates careful consideration and thorough analysis before making any investment decisions.**

title: AI-Generated Cover Letter Fails to Impress Delhi CEO, Sparking Online Debate
news:
A Delhi-based CEO, Ananya Narang, has sparked a social media debate after sharing a job application that clearly demonstrated the perils of relying solely on AI-generated content. The applicant, seeking a content-related role at Narang's company, submitted a cover letter riddled with unedited template placeholders, indicating a complete lack of proofreading.

Narang, founder and CEO of content-as-a-service platform Entourage, expressed her amusement, highlighting the irony of the applicant's oversight given the nature of the position. The incident quickly went viral, with many online users attributing the blunder to ChatGPT, a popular AI-powered chatbot. 

The online community responded with humor, suggesting playful responses to the applicant and emphasizing the importance of human review in the age of AI. Narang even proposed a formal rejection message acknowledging the AI-generated application.

This incident serves as a cautionary tale for job seekers. While AI tools can be helpful, they should never replace human diligence. The need for proofreading, especially for content-related roles, remains paramount, even in a technologically advanced world.

title: North Korea Declares South Korea a Hostile Enemy, Threatens Retaliation
news:
North Korean leader Kim Jong Un has intensified his rhetoric against South Korea, declaring it a hostile foreign enemy and vowing to use force if its sovereignty is violated. This follows North Korea's recent constitutional amendment formally labeling the South as an adversary and the destruction of border infrastructure connecting the two nations. 

Kim's pronouncements mark a significant shift away from past reconciliation efforts and reflect his desire to escalate tensions, potentially as a tactic to gain leverage in stalled diplomatic negotiations. While analysts acknowledge the heightened risk of border clashes, they deem a full-scale attack highly unlikely due to the superior military capabilities of the US and South Korea. 

The North Korean leader has also been increasingly vocal about his nuclear arsenal, threatening to use it against the South and the US. These escalating tensions are further fuelled by North Korea's recent missile tests, which have prompted joint military drills involving the US, South Korea, and Japan.

This aggressive stance coincides with speculation that North Korea might further escalate provocations ahead of the US presidential elections in November, seeking to garner attention from Washington. Potential actions could include a long-range missile launch or even a nuclear test.

title: Shakespeare Gets a Hilarious Makeover in 'Shakespeare in the Wrong Hands'
news:
"Shakespeare in the Wrong Hands," a new play premiering in Bengaluru on October 19, takes the Bard's classic characters and throws them into a comedic whirlwind. The play, written by Bruce Kane and directed by Omkar Kibe, blends Shakespearean tragedy with modern-day humor, turning iconic figures into unexpected characters in absurd situations.

The play, a product of Art Commune Bengaluru's "Script to Stage" workshop, is a result of an intensive theater experience for both beginners and seasoned actors. The workshop aimed to nurture participants' acting skills through a series of games, exercises, and improvisations, guiding them from script analysis to stage performance.

Director Omkar Kibe explains that "Shakespeare in the Wrong Hands" combines educational value with pure entertainment. He emphasizes the play's unique fusion of Shakespearean classics with modern comedic elements, offering a refreshing experience for both seasoned Shakespeare lovers and newcomers.

One of the key challenges during the workshop was the diversity of participants. The workshop brought together individuals with varying levels of experience, requiring the creation of inclusive activities that catered to everyone's needs. 

Kibe highlights the diverse backgrounds of the participants as a strength, noting how their commitment and development have shaped the production into something special. He believes the play will entertain audiences while offering new perspectives on Shakespeare's classics and human behavior.

"Shakespeare in the Wrong Hands" is open to audiences aged 16 and over and will have two shows at 4 p.m. and 7 p.m. Tickets are available at the venue and on BookMyShow.

title: US Accuses Former Indian Intelligence Officer of Plot to Kill Khalistani Leader
news:
The United States has indicted Vikash Yadav, a former officer of India's Research and Analysis Wing (RAW), for allegedly plotting to assassinate Gurpatwant Singh Pannun, a prominent Khalistani separatist leader. The charges, which include conspiracy to commit murder-for-hire and money laundering, were revealed in a New York court.

Yadav, currently at large in India, is accused of directing the assassination plot against Pannun, a dual US-Canadian citizen and leader of Sikhs for Justice (SFJ), a group advocating for an independent Sikh homeland in Punjab. The US is seeking Yadav's extradition.

According to the FBI, the plot was a retaliatory effort by Indian officials against Pannun's separatist activism, which India considers a threat to its national security. 

The indictment alleges that Yadav, working with others in India and abroad, recruited Indian national Nikhil Gupta to carry out the assassination. Gupta was arrested in Prague in 2023 and extradited to the US, where he pleaded not guilty.

While India labels Sikh separatists as "terrorists," Pannun claims the plot was part of a broader directive from top Indian officials, including National Security Advisor Ajit Doval and former RAW Chief Samant Goel.

title: BJP Accuses Siddaramaiah of Complicity in Valmiki Corporation Scam
news:
The BJP has accused Karnataka Chief Minister Siddaramaiah of being complicit in the Karnataka Mahashri Valmiki Scheduled Tribes Development Corporation Ltd. scam, citing his meeting with former Minister B. Nagendra, who is accused of misappropriating funds from the corporation.

The BJP claims that Siddaramaiah's meeting with Nagendra, who was recently released from prison after being arrested by the Enforcement Directorate, is evidence of his involvement in the scam. They point to Siddaramaiah's earlier admission that ₹84 crore from the corporation was misappropriated and his subsequent request for Nagendra's resignation. 

The BJP also questions the timing of the meeting, which occurred on the eve of Maharshi Valmiki Jayanthi, and the announcement of Assembly elections in Maharashtra and Jharkhand. They allege that Siddaramaiah may have discussed with Nagendra the use of funds from other state departments for the Congress campaign in these two states. 

State BJP secretary and Dakshina Kannada MP, Capt. Brijesh Chowta, has called for Siddaramaiah's resignation, citing his alleged complicity in the scam and irregularities in the allotment of MUDA sites. The BJP has vowed to continue fighting for action to be taken against Siddaramaiah and other Congress leaders involved in alleged corruption.

title: Congress Demands Chalavadi Narayanaswamy Return Land Allotted to His Trust
news:
The Karnataka Pradesh Congress Committee (KPCC) has called on Leader of Opposition in the Legislative Council, Chalavadi Narayanaswamy, to return a site allotted to the Adarsha Social and Education Trust, which he heads. 

The demand comes after Narayanaswamy criticized Congress chief Mallikarjun Kharge and his family for allegedly receiving preferential treatment in land allotment. The KPCC spokesperson, Padmaprasad Jain, argued that Narayanaswamy should practice what he preaches by returning the Hoskote site, which was allotted to the trust in 2004 by the Karnataka Housing Board.

Jain alleged that the trust has been using the land for commercial purposes by allowing a biriyani outlet to operate on the site, instead of using it for a school as initially intended. He also accused Narayanaswamy of hypocrisy, stating that he had forgotten his past association with the Congress and his close ties with the Kharge family. 

The KPCC spokesperson further urged the state government to take action against the trust for alleged misuse of the land. He also defended the government's decision to withdraw cases against individuals allegedly involved in riots in Old Hubballi in 2022.  Jain clarified that the decision would only come into effect after the trial court accepts it and that many innocent individuals were among those charged under the Unlawful Activities Prevention Act and Indian Penal Code.

title: From Village College to Japan: 130+ Engineering Graduates Land Jobs in Japanese Companies
news:
Over the past four years, over 130 engineering graduates from the Nitte Mahalinga Adyantaya Memorial Institute of Technology (NMAMIT) in Karnataka, India, have secured employment with Japanese companies. The success story is attributed to strong collaborations between NMAMIT and Japanese companies and universities, leading to increased demand for its graduates.

The graduates, primarily from rural and semi-urban areas along Karnataka's coastal belt, are employed in diverse fields, including IT, mechanical, electrical, electronics, manufacturing, robotics, and artificial intelligence. A notable aspect is that 30% of the employed graduates are women, with 70% hailing from the coastal region.  

The placements started in April 2020, with three companies hiring 10 graduates from NMAMIT for the first time. This momentum has continued, with an estimated 80-100 more graduates set to be placed in Japanese companies by June 2025. 

Japanese companies are impressed with the graduates' dedication and hard work, highlighting the strong educational foundation provided by NMAMIT. To further equip students for success in Japan, NMAMIT offers Japanese language classes, covering cultural aspects and practical skills alongside language learning.  

The university's commitment to international collaborations extends beyond individual placements. NMAMIT has partnered with ten Japanese companies and signed MoUs with six Japanese universities for student and faculty exchanges, joint research projects, and training programs. 

This success story underscores the growing demand for skilled Indian graduates in the Japanese market. The graduates' strong technical foundation, communication skills, and dedication make them highly sought-after by Japanese companies seeking talent.

title: NIT-K's "Engineer 2024" Sparks Innovation with "Enchanted Cosmos" Theme
news:
The National Institute of Technology – Karnataka (NIT-K) kicked off its four-day technical festival, "Engineer 2024," on Thursday at Surathkal. The festival, themed "enchanted cosmos,"  aims to inspire innovation, curiosity, and exploration of the vast universe.

Over 30 events are scheduled throughout the event, which runs until October 20,  attracting an estimated 25,000 visitors.  Highlights include a hackathon, auto expo, gaming events, robotics competitions, drone racing, and a virtual sky tour. 

"Engineer 2024" has historically been a platform for fostering innovative ideas, startup successes, and collaborations between industry and academia. Shilpa R., Managing Director of The Hutti Gold Mines Co. Ltd., inaugurated the event, while Prakash, Executive Director of the same company, served as guest of honor.

title: Embodying the Music: A Tribute to Sarod Legend Pt. Rajeev Taranath
news:
The Pt. Rajeev Taranath Memorial Trust is hosting a commemorative event on October 19th in Bengaluru to celebrate the birth anniversary of the renowned sarod maestro, literary figure, and cultural thinker, who passed away earlier this year.

The event, co-hosted by Karnataka Sahitya Akademi, will feature talks by prominent musicians and literary figures such as Hamsalekha, Boluwar Mohamad Kui, Sarvamangala, and Mukundraj. The evening will conclude with a Hindustani vocal music concert by Pt. Venkatesh Kumar.

The event will celebrate the life and legacy of Pt. Rajeev Taranath, who was known for his profound understanding of Indian music and its connection to the human body. He believed that music was not abstract but rather a concrete experience that fused body, mind, emotion, and spirit.

His unique approach to music, combined with his literary achievements and social commitment, made him a multifaceted and beloved figure. The event aims to honour his memory and continue his legacy of musical excellence and cultural consciousness.

title: Former RAW Official Charged in U.S. for Murder-for-Hire Plot Against Sikh Activist
news:
Vikash Yadav, a former official of India's Research and Analysis Wing (RAW), has been charged in the United States with directing a plot to assassinate Gurpatwant Singh Pannun, leader of the pro-Khalistan Sikhs for Justice (SFJ) organization. The charges, announced by the U.S. Department of Justice (DoJ), include murder-for-hire and conspiracy to commit money laundering. 

Yadav, identified as "CC-1" in the original indictment, allegedly recruited Nikhil Gupta, currently detained in Brooklyn, to find a hitman to kill Pannun, who is a U.S. citizen and designated a terrorist by India.  

The charges come amidst heightened tensions between India and Canada over allegations that Indian government agents were involved in the killing of Hardeep Singh Nijjar, another Khalistani separatist, in Canada.  While India denies these allegations, the U.S. charges against Yadav further complicate the diplomatic situation.

The DoJ stated that Yadav was "employed by the Government of India’s Cabinet Secretariat," which houses RAW, during the period relevant to the case.  However, the U.S. State Department confirmed that Yadav is no longer employed by the Indian government.

The U.S. government has vowed to hold accountable anyone involved in violence against American citizens, regardless of their position or proximity to power.  The charges against Yadav highlight the U.S. concern about transnational repression targeting diaspora communities.

title: Sensorise Revolutionizes Indian eSIM with Remote SIM Provisioning Platform
news:
Sensorise, a leader in IoT M2M services, has launched India's first Remote SIM Provisioning (RSP) platform, SenseProM, specifically for consumer SIMs. Unveiled at the Indian Mobile Congress 2024, SenseProM enables users to manage their eSIM profiles effortlessly, eliminating the need for physical SIM cards.

This platform is built on the GSMA's consumer architecture (SGP.22) and includes the essential SM-DP+ component, guaranteeing secure eSIM profile management. SenseProM allows users to download, activate, and switch between mobile networks effortlessly, providing full control over their connectivity. 

The SM-DP+ component ensures secure transmission, profile management, subscription oversight, and lifecycle management of eSIM profiles, ensuring safety and efficiency.

VoyX, a global travel eSIM solution, is the first product to utilize this platform. Designed for frequent travelers, VoyX provides connectivity in over 140 countries with flexible data packs, making international travel more seamless.

Sensorise plans to expand SenseProM's capabilities beyond consumers, with future enhancements focusing on SGP.32 for Machine-to-Machine (M2M) interoperability with global telcos. This launch marks a significant step towards advancing mobile connectivity in India, setting the stage for a more flexible and user-friendly eSIM experience.

title: Biden Calls Killing of Hamas Leader 'Good Day' for Israel and World
news:
U.S. President Joe Biden hailed the killing of Hamas leader Yahya Sinwar as a "good day" for Israel and the world, following confirmation of his death by Israeli authorities. Biden attributed Sinwar's death to the combined efforts of U.S. intelligence and the Israel Defense Forces. He emphasized that Israel had the right to eliminate terrorists and that Sinwar was responsible for the deaths of thousands of Israelis, Palestinians, Americans, and citizens from over 30 countries during the October 7th attack on Israel. 

Biden said the killing of Sinwar, who he described as the mastermind behind the "massacres, rapes, and kidnappings," marked an opportunity for peace in Gaza. He acknowledged that much work remains to achieve a lasting political settlement, but he believes the removal of Sinwar is a crucial step toward a future without Hamas.

title: Hamas Leader Yahya Sinwar Killed in Gaza: Israel
news:
Israeli forces have confirmed the death of Yahya Sinwar, the leader of Hamas, in a targeted operation in Gaza. The Israeli military confirmed the action, stating they are actively searching for Sinwar's brother Muhammad and other Hamas military commanders. 

Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu, referring to Sinwar's death, stated that Israel "settled its account," indicating the operation was a direct retaliation for the October 7th attacks by Hamas.

Following the news, US Secretary of State Antony Blinken affirmed that the US will redouble efforts to end the ongoing war in Gaza, aiming for a swift resolution.

title: NC MLA Faces Inquiry for Sitting During National Anthem at Omar Abdullah's Swearing-in Ceremony
news:
Hilal Akbar Lone, an NC legislator representing the Sonawari constituency in North Kashmir, is facing scrutiny after he was allegedly seen seated during the playing of the national anthem at the swearing-in ceremony of the new Jammu and Kashmir government on October 16th.

Lone has defended his actions, stating that he had medical issues, specifically a backache, and was unable to stand for an extended period. He maintains that he had no intention of disrespecting the national anthem and cited Supreme Court observations that being seated during the national anthem is not a crime.

The Jammu and Kashmir Police have initiated a preliminary inquiry into the incident, examining electronic evidence to determine if further legal action is warranted. The investigation is being led by a Superintendent of Police-rank officer under Section 173 (3) of the BNSS (Bharatiya Nagarik Suraksha Sanhita).

title: Mumbai's Infrastructure Boom: A Development Built on Discontent?
news:
Mumbai's ambitious infrastructure projects, while aiming to elevate the city to world-class standards, are facing strong opposition from residents and activists. Concerns center around disregard for environmental regulations and a lack of inclusive planning, particularly impacting fishing communities.

Fisherfolk in areas like Gavhan, Uran, and Gorai are experiencing shrinking fishing grounds and the destruction of vital mangrove ecosystems due to projects like the Jawaharlal Nehru Port Trust (JNPT), Mumbai Trans Harbour Link (MTHL), and Navi Mumbai International Airport (NMIA).  

The depletion of mangroves, essential for coastal protection and fishing livelihoods, has sparked widespread anger.  Fisherfolk, who rely on these ecosystems for their survival, fear displacement and the loss of their ancestral lands.  The construction of the Madh Island-Versova flyover, for instance, has led to the clearing of mangroves and encroaches upon residential areas, raising concerns about the well-being of local communities.

The plight of the Uran Koliwada community exemplifies the struggle.  The once pristine Uran creek now reeks of chemicals and sewage, depleted of fish.  The residents were even arrested in February 2023 for protesting the Uran Bypass Road construction, highlighting the disregard for their concerns.

While the government cites increased mangrove cover in the state, critics argue that the focus on development comes at the expense of ecological preservation and the well-being of fishing communities. The question remains: is Mumbai's modernization truly inclusive and sustainable, or does it come at the cost of its most vulnerable residents?

title: Muvattupuzha Urban Cooperative Bank Embraces Digital Future
news:
The Muvattupuzha Urban Cooperative Bank is set to launch its new digital platform on October 18th. This initiative aims to enhance customer experience by providing access to the latest banking technology. 

The launch event will be held at the bank's auditorium and will feature the platform's unveiling by Reserve Bank of India General Manager Shini Sunil. Bank Chairman A.A. Anshad will preside over the ceremony, and Kerala Bank President Gopi Kottamurikkal will unveil the new logo. 

This digital platform signifies the bank's commitment to modernization and customer convenience in an increasingly digital world.

title: Hotel Owner and Two Employees Arrested for Assaulting Juvenile Workers in K.K. Nagar
news:
Chennai, India - A hotel owner and two of his employees have been arrested for assaulting three teenage boys who worked at the establishment. The incident occurred in K.K. Nagar, Chennai, on October 13th.

The owner, identified as R. Mahalingam, and his staff, P. Tamizharasan and N. Nagappan, reportedly attacked the boys after they brought friends to their room in the hotel. The boys, aged 16 and 17, were employed as workers and lived on the premises.  Following the attack, the boys were locked in their room but managed to escape through a window. They were subsequently admitted to a hospital, who alerted the police.

Police have registered a case and arrested the three suspects. They are currently remanded in judicial custody.

title: Amma Canteens Provide Free Meals to Over 1.4 Million People in Chennai
news:
Amma canteens in Chennai, Tamil Nadu, distributed free meals to over 1.46 million people over the course of two days, October 16th and 17th. This initiative was launched by Chief Minister M.K. Stalin in response to heavy rains affecting the city. 

In addition to the free food, 304 medical camps were set up across Chennai, providing assistance to over 17,400 individuals. The city's 22 subways have been cleared of floodwater, allowing vehicular traffic to resume. 

Chief Minister Stalin, along with Deputy Chief Minister Udhayanidhi Stalin and several ministers, visited rain-affected areas in Chennai over the past three days. The initiative highlights the government's efforts to support the city's population during the monsoon season.

title: Chennai Police to Hold "Petition Mela" for Victims of Purasawalkam Santhatha Sanga Nidhi Ltd.
news:
