title: Valmiki Jayanti Celebrated in Yadgir and Raichur
news:
On Thursday, October 17th, 2024, Valmiki Jayanti was celebrated in the Indian districts of Yadgir and Raichur. The day marked the birth anniversary of the revered sage Valmiki, author of the Hindu epic Ramayana.

In both districts, colorful processions featuring folk troupes carried the portrait of Valmiki. In Yadgir, Congress MLA Channareddy Patil Tunnur emphasized Valmiki's dedication to education, calling his life an exemplary model.  Bhagya Dhore, during a special lecture, advocated for the inclusion of Valmiki's life story in school textbooks to inspire future generations. In Raichur, Congress MP G. Kumar Naik, MLA Shivaraj Patil, and other elected officials paid homage to Valmiki by garlanding his statue. They urged the public to follow Valmiki's teachings. Deputy Commissioner Nitish K. was also present at the event.

title: 32 New Homes Delivered to Sri Lankan Tamil Refugees in Sivakasi
news:
The Tamil Nadu government has delivered 32 new homes to Sri Lankan Tamil refugees in Sivakasi, marking a significant step in their rehabilitation efforts. The newly constructed units, totaling 24 at Anuppankulam and 8 at Sevalur, were inaugurated by Finance Minister Thangam Thennarasu on Thursday.

The project, costing ₹1.80 crore, is part of a larger scheme announced by Chief Minister M. K. Stalin to provide comprehensive support to Sri Lankan Tamil refugees. This includes housing, educational assistance for professional and post-graduate courses, skill-development training, and ration, all costing a total of ₹300 crore.

The Virudhunagar Collector, V.P. Jeyaseelan, stated that the project will be implemented in three phases, with a total of 850 homes planned for construction. Of these, 200 have been handed over, and another 600 are scheduled for delivery soon.

The inauguration ceremony was attended by several dignitaries, including MLAs A. R. R. Srinivasan and A. R. R. Raghuraman, and Sivakasi Mayor, I. Sangeetha.

title: Pawan Kalyan Extends Birthday Greetings to AIADMK, Praises MGR's Legacy

title: Over 2,000 Development Projects Completed in Panamarathupatti in Three Years
news:
Salem, India -  The District Collector of Salem, R. Brindha Devi, has announced the completion of over 2,000 development projects in the Panamarathupatti panchayat union in the past three years. The projects, funded by various schemes like the Chief Minister’s Rural Road Development programme, Anaithu Grama Anna Marumalarchi Thittam, and the Mahatma Gandhi National Rural Employment Guarantee Scheme, among others, totaled over ₹101.43 crore.

The Collector personally inspected ongoing works in the area, including a bus shelter, a community hall, a community toilet, road repairs, additional classrooms for primary schools, a walking path, cement road laying works, and an overhead water tank. She emphasized the importance of regular inspections to ensure timely and quality completion of all projects. 

While 2,031 projects have been completed, 836 are still underway and are expected to be finished soon. The Collector reassured the public that officials have been instructed to complete all projects within the stipulated timeframe.

title: REEP Foundation to Clean Up Polluted Kallai River
news:
The Rights, Equity, and Environment Protection (REEP) Foundation, based in Bengaluru, is taking the lead in cleaning up the Kallai River in Kozhikode, Kerala. The initiative comes after a report from the Central Pollution Control Board declared the river, which runs through the city center, as the most polluted in Kerala.

REEP Foundation will collaborate with the District Administration, Kozhikode Corporation, and other stakeholders to develop a Detailed Project Report (DPR) for the clean-up. This includes a 30-year plan for the river’s revitalization. 

The project faces several challenges, including widespread pollution from various sources:

* **Industrial Waste:**  Closed industrial units and dumping of waste materials on the riverbanks are a major source of contamination.
* **Timber Industry:** Timber dumping and outdated seasoning practices contribute to water quality degradation.
* **Coconut Husk Processing:** The disposal of coconut husks for coir fiber production pollutes the river.
* **Encroachment:**  Large-scale encroachment of revenue land and unsurrendered lease properties by private entities further exacerbate the issue.

Previous efforts by the River Protection Council have not yielded significant results. The REEP Foundation hopes to bring together stakeholders to develop a comprehensive and effective plan to restore the Kallai River to a healthy state.

title: Valmiki Jayanti Celebrated with Colorful Processions and Folk Performances
news:

title: Salem Minister Distributes Safety Equipment to Conservancy Workers for Chennai Relief Efforts
news:
Salem, Tamil Nadu - In preparation for the northeast monsoon season and to assist Chennai's relief efforts, the Tamil Nadu Minister for Tourism, R. Rajendran, distributed safety equipment to 200 conservancy workers from Salem Corporation. These workers, along with 10 supervisors and a cleanliness inspector, were sent to Chennai on Thursday, October 17th, in four buses. 

The Minister emphasized Chief Minister M.K. Stalin's focus on precautionary measures to mitigate the impact of monsoon rains in Chennai.  The Salem workers will help alleviate the workload of Chennai Corporation staff, enabling them to focus on relief efforts. 

Along with the workers, four lorries were dispatched carrying essential safety equipment, including raincoats, gloves, reflex jackets, and work-related tools. Additional supplies, such as mats, blankets, and bedsheets, were also sent for the workers' comfort.

Salem Corporation Commissioner Ranjeet Singh highlighted the importance of 24/7 ward committee operations during the monsoon season. The committee members are tasked with monitoring water bodies and storm water drains, ensuring the availability of sandbags in case of weakened bunds, and preparing public shelters with adequate facilities.  He also emphasized the importance of maintaining the availability of necessary equipment, including cutting machines, diesel engines, and vehicles, and encouraged the use of WhatsApp number 83003-83003 for communication with the Salem Corporation main office.

title: Kerala HC Grants Bail to 6th Accused in RSS Worker Murder Case
news:
The Kerala High Court has granted bail to Muhammed Haroon, the sixth accused in the murder of Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS) worker Sanjith in Palakkad in 2021. The court cited Haroon's extended period of detention, his lack of previous criminal record, and the need to establish his role in the crime during the trial.

Sanjith was attacked and killed on November 15, 2021, while travelling with his wife. The prosecution alleges that Haroon and five other accused, members of the now-banned Popular Front of India (PFI), were involved in the attack due to political animosity.

The court acknowledged that Haroon was a member of the PFI, but noted that the organization was not banned at the time of the crime. Therefore, his membership alone does not warrant continued incarceration. The court further emphasized that it is the prosecution's responsibility to prove his specific role in the murder during the trial.

title: Mysuru Railway Station Sees Record Passenger Traffic During Dasara
news:
Mysuru witnessed a surge in rail passenger traffic during the 10-day Dasara festival, with over 920,000 passengers utilizing the city's main railway station alone. The total passenger footfall across all stations in the city surpassed one million, with a peak of 120,000 passengers on Vijayadashami (October 12th). 

This surge in passenger traffic led to a significant increase in earnings for the Mysuru Railway Station, reaching ₹7.37 crore during Dasara, compared to ₹6.64 crore earned during the same period last year. 

To manage the influx of passengers, the Mysuru Division deployed additional staff, including ticket examiners, commercial staff, and Railway Protection Force personnel across major stations in and around Mysuru. 

The division also introduced several measures to enhance passenger experience and ensure smooth operations, including:

* **Improved passenger navigation and information systems:** Additional signage boards were installed across platforms to provide clear directions.
* **Mobile Unreserved Ticketing System (MUTS) pilot project:** This contactless ticketing option reduced congestion at booking counters.
* **Relocated Automatic Ticket Vending Machines:** This also helped alleviate crowding at booking counters.
* **Additional pre-printed ticket counters:** Opened at the station and divisional office to reduce waiting times.
* **Enhanced security measures:** Installation of additional CCTV cameras, baggage scanners, and deployment of a dedicated dog squad for anti-sabotage checks.

The Mysuru Railway Division attributes the successful management of the peak passenger traffic to the initiative of Divisional Railway Manager Shilpi Agarwal, who implemented comprehensive arrangements for a seamless and enjoyable passenger experience throughout the festive period.
